title: Implement skill name normalization utilities
description:
## Context

Agent Skills names must follow strict validation rules: lowercase alphanumeric + hyphens, no consecutive hyphens, no leading/trailing hyphens, 1-64 characters. War Rig program names (CBACT01C, CBPAUP0C, etc.) need normalization.

## Requirements

1. Create `war_rig/skills/naming.py` with normalization utilities
2. Implement `normalize_skill_name(filename: str) -> str` function
3. Implement `validate_skill_name(name: str) -> bool` function
4. Handle edge cases:
   - Uppercase conversion to lowercase
   - Underscores replaced with hyphens
   - Numeric prefixes (prefix with 'n-' or similar)
   - Special characters removed
   - Consecutive hyphens collapsed
   - Leading/trailing hyphens stripped
   - Length truncation to 64 chars

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] normalize_skill_name("CBACT01C.cbl.doc.json") -> "cbact01c"
- [ ] normalize_skill_name("MY_PROGRAM") -> "my-program"
- [ ] normalize_skill_name("test__name") -> "test-name" (no consecutive hyphens)
- [ ] normalize_skill_name("-test-") -> "test" (no leading/trailing hyphens)
- [ ] validate_skill_name returns True only for valid names
- [ ] Handles empty strings and None gracefully
- [ ] All functions have type hints and Google docstrings

## Technical Notes

- Agent Skills spec: lowercase alphanumeric + hyphens, 1-64 chars
- Parent directory name must match skill name field in SKILL.md frontmatter
- Consider using regex for validation
close_reason: Implemented naming utilities with normalize_skill_name, validate_skill_name, create_skill_frontmatter, and truncate_description functions. All 75 tests pass.

title: Add Citadel context loading to ChallengerWorker
description:
## Context

The ChallengerWorker (challenger_pool.py) currently does not use Citadel static analysis at all. The ScribeWorker already has a pattern for loading Citadel context -- see _get_citadel_context() at line 336 of scribe_pool.py, which calls citadel.get_functions() and citadel.get_includes(). We need an equivalent capability in the ChallengerWorker so the structural pre-check can access ground-truth paragraph names, call relationships, and copybook includes.

## Requirements

1. Add a Citadel SDK import and initialization to ChallengerWorker.__init__() (file: war_rig/workers/challenger_pool.py, line ~132-177). Follow the same pattern as ScribeWorker which initializes self._citadel in __init__ and gracefully handles the case where Citadel is unavailable (returns None).

2. Add a _get_citadel_context(self, file_path: str) method to ChallengerWorker that:
   - Calls self._citadel.analyze_file(file_path) to get a FileAnalysisResult (see citadel/src/citadel/sdk.py line 227)
   - Extracts: list of paragraph/function names with line ranges (FileArtifact.name, line_start, line_end), per-paragraph outgoing callouts (FileArtifact.callouts -> Callout.target, relationship, line), and preprocessor includes (FileAnalysisResult.preprocessor_includes)
   - Returns a structured dict or dataclass with: paragraphs (list of {name, line_start, line_end, calls: [{target, type, line}]}), includes (list of str), dead_code (list of dict -- from cached dead code, same pattern as ScribeWorker)
   - Returns None gracefully if Citadel unavailable or analysis fails (log at debug level)

3. The file_path for Citadel must be resolved from ticket metadata. See _load_documentation_state() line 676-678 which reads metadata["file_path"]. Alternatively, resolve from ticket.file_name + config input_directory, same as ScribeWorker line 658-661.

4. Add _find_perform_thru_targets(self, file_path: str) -> set[str] method (copy pattern from scribe_pool.py line 434-466) -- needed to filter false positive dead code from structural check.

## Acceptance Criteria

- ChallengerWorker has self._citadel attribute initialized in __init__ (None if Citadel unavailable)
- _get_citadel_context returns structured data with paragraphs, includes, dead_code
- Method handles errors gracefully (returns None, logs debug)
- _find_perform_thru_targets reuses the PERFORM THRU regex pattern from ScribeWorker
- No new external dependencies required (Citadel SDK is already in the project)

## Files to Modify

- war_rig/workers/challenger_pool.py (ChallengerWorker class)

## Dependencies

None -- this is the foundational ticket.

title: Implement system overview skill generation
description:
## Context

The system overview skill serves as the index for progressive discovery. It should help agents find relevant programs by listing all documented programs with brief descriptions.

## Requirements

1. Create `war_rig/skills/overview_skill.py` with `OverviewSkillGenerator` class
2. Generate system-overview/SKILL.md from:
   - SYSTEM_OVERVIEW.md (if exists)
   - Or synthesize from individual program docs
3. SKILL.md frontmatter:
   ```yaml
   ---
   name: system-overview
   description: Index of documented programs in the system. Use this skill to find programs by business function or technical purpose.
   metadata:
     author: war-rig
     version: "1.0"
     total_programs: <count>
   ---
   ```
4. SKILL.md body should include:
   - System summary/executive overview
   - Program catalog (name, type, brief description)
   - Instructions for using other skills
   - How to navigate to specific program skills

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Reads SYSTEM_OVERVIEW.md if available
- [ ] Falls back to synthesizing from program docs if no overview
- [ ] Lists all programs with: name, type, one-line description
- [ ] Groups programs by type (BATCH, ONLINE, COPYBOOK)
- [ ] Includes navigation instructions for finding specific program skills
- [ ] Total programs count in metadata
- [ ] Stays under 500 lines

## Technical Notes

- The system overview is the entry point for agents exploring the codebase
- Should enable agents to quickly find relevant programs without loading all skills
- Reference SYSTEM_OVERVIEW.md structure in example_output/README.md

title: [codewhisper] Implement skills loader and discovery
description:
## Context
Codewhisper needs to load and discover Agent Skills from a directory. Skills are markdown files with YAML frontmatter containing name and description fields.

## Requirements
1. Create skills/loader.py for loading skills from directory
2. Parse YAML frontmatter from SKILL.md files
3. Build skill index for fast lookup by name
4. Support hierarchical skill organization (e.g., programs/copau00/SKILL.md)

## Skills Format (from example_output/skills/)
```yaml
---
name: copau00
description: "This COBOL copybook defines..."
---
# COPAU00
...
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SkillLoader class loads skills from directory
- [ ] Parses YAML frontmatter (name, description)
- [ ] Supports recursive directory scanning
- [ ] Skill model with name, description, content, path fields
- [ ] get_skill_by_name() lookup function
- [ ] list_skills() returns all available skills
- [ ] Handles missing/malformed skill files gracefully

## Technical Notes
- Skills directory structure: skills/{category}/{skill-name}/SKILL.md
- Also support: skills/{category}/SKILL.md (e.g., system-overview, call-graph)
- Use pathlib for path handling
- Parse YAML with pyyaml
- Cache loaded skills for performance
